content.body: I'm just worried about Istvan showing up and saying something like, "well I told them it wasn't necessary, so the matter is settled already"

content.body: Istvan is excluded from most of these discussions; this is why he was expressing so much confusion in his update to committee
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Istvan is excluded from most of these discussions; this is why he was expressing so much confusion in his update to committee

content.body: one way to make it less ignorable could be to add that delegates are reluctant to go back to giving up their participation in the meeting just for taking notes; that ups the urgency a bit. but like I said, you know the audience better than I do, what I said might backfire

content.body: Well, this could go either way, but I think explaining the threat of a note-taker strike would be better in the subsequent discussion.

content.body: I also think Michael would respond negatively to any characterization of all note-takers saying one thing or another, since he takes notes sometimes, as he said in that discussion
